header.gameNote: ISLANDER INVITATIONAL AT CORPUS CHRISTI TX

article.headline: Georgia Southern 78, Texas A&amp,M-Corpus Christi 69
article.story: CORPUS CHRISTI, Texas (AP) -- Louis Graham scored 19 points to lead Georgia Southern to a 78-69 win over Texas A&M-Corpus Christi on Friday night in the opening round of the Islander Invitational. The Eagles (9-2) fell behind by as many as seven points in the opening minutes, but used a 9-4 run to cut their deficit to two about midway through the first half. A Trumaine Pearson layup with 5:22 left in the half put Georgia Southern up for good. Willie Powers scored 11 points for Georgia Southern. Matthew Fields had 10 rebounds, while the Eagles picked up 10 steals. They overcame a double-double from the Islanders' Justin Reynolds, who finished with 22 points and 12 rebounds. It was his fourth double-double of the season. The Islanders fell to 2-8. Georgia Southern will play Rhode Island in the tournament championship game Saturday.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
